1. The present simple of the verb be has three forms:
• I am.
• He/She/It is.
• You/We/They are.

3. We use he for a man, she for a woman, and it for a thing: 
• He’s strong. 
• She’s beautiful. 
• I like this car. It’s very fast.
4. We use they for people and for things: \n• I love Christy and Jonas. They’re my friends. \n• I love these cars. They are very beautiful.

5. We use ‘m, ‘s and ‘re with personal pronouns (I, you, he, she, etc.): 
• I’m tired. 
• You’re funny. 
• She’s from America. 
 But we can use ‘s with names: 
• Jessica’s beautiful. 
• London’s an expensive city. 
• Mark’s clever.
6. We always need a subject before the verb: \n• It is hot (NOT Is hot) \n• Nevera is a fast car (NOT is a fast car)

7. We can only use contractions in negative short answer. Not in positive short answers: 
• Yes, I am (NOT Yes, I’m) 
• Yes, you are (NOT Yes, you’re) 
• Yes, he is (NOT Yes, he’s) 
• Yes, she is (NOT Yes, she’s) 
• Yes, we are (NOT Yes, we’re) 
• Yes, they are ( Not Yes, they’re)
